definition: to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Are we the mediators that pull warring sides together?
sentences.chinese: 我们是将交战双方拉近的调停者吗？

sentences.english: Those who in quarrels interpose must often wipe a bloody nose.
sentences.chinese: 那些吵架的调停者必须时常抹鼻血。

sentences.english: Most of all, the prime minister can thank his long-serving team of advisers and fixers .
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是首相要感谢顾问团队及调停者的不懈努力。

sentences.english: The dispute was settled by mediation.
sentences.chinese: 这场争端通过调停而得到解决。

sentences.english: He interposes himself between the two persons who are quarrelling.
sentences.chinese: 他在两个吵架的人之间进行调停。

sentences.english: The old man likes to interpose in the disputes.
sentences.chinese: 这位老人喜欢调停争论。

sentences.english: Your mind and various emotions are employed as the mediators between the two.
sentences.chinese: 你的心智和各种不同的情感受雇于二者间的调停角色。

sentences.english: Will China play a mediatory role in the current crisis in Libya?
sentences.chinese: 中方是否会为解决利比亚当前危机发挥调停作用？

sentences.english: It is reported that the common law at the G8 summit, also urged the Russian mediation.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，英美法在G8峰会上也促请俄罗斯进行调停。

sentences.english: He is the only divine-human Mediator.
sentences.chinese: 他是唯一的神和人之间的调停者。

sentences.english: The mediator attempted to get both sides to modify their positions.
sentences.chinese: 这个调停者试图让双方对各自的立场都做一下变动。

sentences.english: He always takes the role of a mediator in any dispute.
sentences.chinese: 他总是在争论中充当调停人的角色。

sentences.english: They mediated a settlement between labour and management.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过调停解决了劳资纠纷。

sentences.english: But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague came to an end.
sentences.chinese: 丕乃哈斯奋起调停，这灾祸才止息平定。

sentences.english: Advocates find their calling on the mediational side of diplomatic intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 拥护者在策略智慧的调停方面，找到了他们的定位。

sentences.english: I intervened in the quarrel between my father and mother.
sentences.chinese: 父母争吵，我居中进行了调停。

definition: to mediate/to bring parties to an agreement
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
